intro: Impatiens kilimanjari subsp. pocsii, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting darker center. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically hairy, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 2,500 meters. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
